BPM and Enterprise Architecture compete for resources and are usually managed by separate departments with little collaboration.
Enterprise Architecture is a subset of BPM, focusing solely on the IT processes and systems.

BPM and Enterprise Architecture are complementary, with BPM focusing on the improvement of business processes and Enterprise Architecture ensuring that IT systems align with business goals.

An artifact in Enterprise Architecture refers to any document, model, or piece of information that is produced during the creation of an enterprise architecture. Examples include architecture diagrams, data models, and standards.

Enterprise Security Architecture is primarily concerned with physical security measures, while Enterprise Architecture deals with information systems.
